Are you using ext4?
why did you asked me if I were using ext4
First thing I would do is boot into a liveCD and make sure that you backup any files that are important to you, and don't force shutdown your computer even if it seems completely frozen

ext4 Has a bug where files can be lost if the computer looses power ( though that may not be what is happening to you, it's not common and luckily almost never affects user's data, just configuration files )
By reinstalling all of the packages whose files are zero bytes, but it could also be a bad drive or some other problem entirely so you should back up any important data now
I would do an fsck and try to figure out what went wrong, if it's a bad drive you might want to get rid of it
Also try memtest
You will need to boot into recovery mode or a liveCD to run fsck
